data.title: Love this place
data.text: We were in down town Billings looking for something different. And what a great find in this place. The staff was great and the food was wonderful. Definitely will be going back

data.title: Not bad for LA in MT!
data.text: We're from the south and have spent a lot of time in Louisiana so we were somewhat skeptical at the idea of Cajun food in Montana but we were pleasantly surprised!! On a Friday night when we were tired of leftovers we decided to give Cafe Zydeco a try for take out. We figured we should go straight to the heart of the matter and ordered gumbo and etouffee. Both were pretty spot on for quality and might actually be in the top three Cajun food selections that we've had outside of Louisiana. If I had to nitpick, I'd say that the etoufee was just a tad too spicy - both in terms of being a bit too hot, but also having so much spice that it almost had a gritty texture to it. We're hoping this was just an off night because we plan to make this a take out staple!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: One of my favorite places in town for lunch! Excellent food and service. It's a little bit of NOLA in Montana.

data.title: Good southern food
data.text: Saturday beignets!!!!!!!! Praline sauce is ridiculous! If you've never been there for breakfast you are missing out! Such great food!

data.title: Surprising Menu!
data.text: When my husband and I entered this restaurant, it was not quite what we were expecting! Dinner hour and absolutely no one was in this little tiny place. You order at the counter from a board menu and pay the cashier. There are a few brands of beer available, too. I must say, my Cajun Taco was amazing and the Hush Puppies were some of the best I have ever had! My fussy-about-his-NOLA foods husband, really liked the Shrimp Etoufee and Jambalaya. A quirky little place but we enjoyed our meal!

data.title: So good!
data.text: They have gluten free bread and excellent po' boy sandwiches. Something for everyone to enjoy even if they don't think they like Cajun cuisine. I need to try their beignets.

data.title: Very good food
data.text: Enjoyed the food, the service, the area.  Would definitely visit again.  The corn fetters were especially tasty.

data.title: Cajun food
data.text: Delicious Po Boys and Gumbo, the Crawfish and shrimp Po boy is awesome! Going to New Orleans soon so I can compare :-)

data.title: A taste of NOLA in billings
data.text: Good food, good atmosphere. New Orleans food in Billings. Gumbo, Poboys, Grits.... Cajun music.... accordions on the wall... portraits of famous NO musicians. YUM

data.title: Great lunch!
data.text: I stopped in to this sandwich style restaurant for some local flare and was not disappointed! The food menu is unique to the area with its Louisiana style menu. If you love meat, this is the place for you. Service was excellent and noticeable that they were appreciative of their customers in the way the food was presented and follow up from the waitress. Enjoy!

data.title: So tasty!
data.text: Great food! Great flavor!  A fun atmosphere to go have a lunch or dinner.  I love the Jambalaya! I highly recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Cajun good!
data.text: Loved this place. Partly it's the Cajun/bluegrass music that's just so lively and fun. My husband was expecting little fish bit triangles when he ordered fish and chips and was pleasantly surprised with spicy, crispy most likely catfish pieces and he really enjoyed them. I had a Rubin po'boy  that was very big and filling as well as delicious. The service is great. This was a nice treat compared to usual fare.

data.title: A wonderful surprise in Billings!
data.text: The last place I would have looked for authentic Cajun cuisine would have to be in Montana. And then to find it in Billings to top it off tumbled my gyros!  We were thoroughly impressed by the extensive menu of Po' Boys, Jambalaya,  Gumbo,  etouffe, red beans and rice, and on and on. I finally settled on the Zydeco Pasta; a dish chuck full of shrimp,  andouillle sausage, crawfish and rotini pasta smothered in a red Cajun sauce that was tasty and spicy but not with excessive heat. My wife was overcome with the joy of eating a freak yellow fin tuna sandwich smothered in sauté d peppers and onions,  also with a perfect sauce. We both walked away with enough for a second meal each and it was all at a price even a pauper can afford. Enjoy this little hole in the wall next time you're in Billings. Bon appetite. .

data.title: Almost Serve Yourself
data.text: This cafe is nestled on Montana Avenue. The decor is interesting and great. Menu items are definitely varied, I didn't try the alligator. I did enjoy the pulled pork sandwich. Everyone in our party agreed the food was fantastic. It almost made up for the lack of service. We did not arrive at rush hour as there were only two other people in the cafe. We seemed to be an inconvenience to the server. I suspect we interrupted whatever she was watching.  I even had the audacity to request a fork and we never did see her again to ask for ketchup. Don't know if we'll return as we wouldn't want to interrupt her day again!

data.title: Best bread pudding I've ever had
data.text: My husband and I stopped in just for a snack. He picked out the bread pudding and I am so happy he did! It was AMAZING!

data.title: An authentic and cultural experience
data.text: My husband had the seafood gumbo that he liked but just wasn't used to (if that makes sense). I had a reuben sandwich that was terrific and desert was a bread pudding in a praline sauce that was excellent. Atmosphere is like being in New Orleans. Staff were nice.

data.title: Pretty good and huge servings! Close to authentic
data.text: My husband was born and raised in Louisiana for 23 years. He has been to some wonderful places to eat in his life. He was excited to learn of this place as we will occasionally come to Billings from Wyoming to shop and eat. The flavors were very nice, so many great Cajun dishes to chose from. We do wish it was just a little more spicy Cajun that we are used to. But overall great meals :)

data.title: Bring Sum' South To Your Mouf'!
data.text: Hey... I'm impressed! This is very good Cajun food. In Montana? Well, I thought I was really sitting New Orleans or the bayou eating Cajun. I had the lunch special for $9.95 for a huge, well prepared and delicious tasting plate of jambalaya (including andouille sausage, chicken, nice shrimp with corn cheese fritters). This place is definitely worth a try, and I will be back next occasion that I'm in town! There's an extensive menu of po' boys and other Acadian delights.

data.title: Ample Servings, Great Taste, Affordable Lunches
data.text:
I walk by this restaurant nearly every week day and finally stopped in on a whim for lunch today and I am very glad I did! Try it out if you like Louisiana style food!

Cafe Zydeco is easy to find on Montana Avenue, just a couple blocks east of 27th Street.  The cafe resides in one of the historic buildings downtown and therefore the atmosphere is quite unique.  There are not a lot of seats available in the front but the place did not seem crowded.  The high-top table chairs were plush and comfortable. You order from the counter but can request a menu to peruse if you prefer. Definitely a win on the atmosphere overall, my only "complaint" is that there was pretty limited seating and it could get pretty full pretty quickly. 

I ordered the special, Jambalaya with corn fritters, for $9.95 and it came with a soda that I served myself. When my order arrived, I was surprised by the ample serving and was very pleased with the aroma.  The jambalaya was spicy but not over-done and the corn fritters were crispy outside and full-flavored inside.  They have a selection of hot sauces, which I tried and found that the Garlic Tabasco complimented quite nicely.  The andouille sausage was nicely sizzled, the shrimp cooked but firm, and the rice was nicely covered with sauce - not too much, not too little. 

I was able to eat all of what I was given but am a little over-full.  A smaller person would most likely leave with extra. 

I noticed that they have a Reuben sandwich on their menu, and being a lover of Reubens, I will return to give theirs a try.  I have been on the search for the world's best Reuben sandwich and have yet to find THE one...

Bottom line, go there and get some great Cajun / Louisiana style food.

data.title: Authentic Cajun Food
data.text: We have had brunch and lunch here and everything was delicious.  Staff is friendly and the service is good.  Food is delicious and authentic.
